Frenetic camera. Joe searches the pockets of his shorts, pants, everything he brought with him. He pulls the pocke inside out. Two nickels in one. The rest are empty. His expression grows dire. In one of the pockets, we hear the crisp rustle of money he pulls something from a pocket, but it’s not cash: it’s old Boston Market order, scribbled onto a torn sheet of paper. Shit. He chucks it aside. He dumps out the contents of his DUFFEL BAG. Rummages through the pile. Beneath some junky housewares, he unexpectedly finds... The library books. Still unopened. “WALDEN.”...”105 OUTDO RECIPES”...”“SO YOU WANT TO BUILD A CABIN”... And most appropriately: “I’D RATHER BE HUNTING.” Joe regards it with curiosity...  96. CAPT. DAVIS’S VOICE From a statement given by Patrick McGuire...
Frank sits across from CAPTAIN ARTY DAVIS (45). Frank lea against the wall behind them, watching. The Captain reads from a file.

“May 12th. We had a fight. Over something stupid, but...you know. It got out of hand. I came home; there was no point in going on if we were fighting. (then) The destination was Tallahassee. It was Joe’s choice, he told me he liked the word, liked that it had three double-letters.”
Hm. Seems arbitrary.
(nodding) Patrick continues: “I don’t pretend to understand the guy. I just want him to be okay. Let me know what you find out.” Davis closes the file. Frank frowns.
I know. But I looked in his eyes, Mr. Toy. He was telling the truth.
And the other kid?
Frank and the Captain look through a two-way mirror: Biag stands next to a chair, across from two seated COPS.
Biaggio Verga. McGuire says he was with them the whole time. (MORE )

I’m afraid he’s given us nothing so far...he has a contempt for the law I’ve never seen in a minor. The captain presses a speaker button on a console. We hea the conversation in the interrogation room.
Why don’t you sit down so we can have a nice discussion. We’re all pals, right? No reason not to be.
(to Frank) He won’t sit. Won’t deflate the room. It’s actually very sophisticated. Biaggio walks to the two-way mirror and stares through it He knows he’s being watched.
This kid is in my head. Biaggio returns to the chair, picks it up and walks calml toward the glass. The two cops quickly move toward him.
Whoa whoa whoa. None of that. They wrestle the chair from him.
He knows something. Maybe a lot. Frank stares at Biaggio.
Wide. To establish.

A EUROPEAN STARLING steps gingerly toward a pile of appetizing berries. Reaching down to PECK, the ground suddenly collapses bene it. It disappears into a hole. We hear sounds of distress Joe jumps out from behind a tree, holding his SWORD. He charges the hole, upon it in less than a second.  98.
Bah! Murder! Murder! Murder! He stabs downward until we hear no more sounds of distres Joe pants, falls to his knees, rattled.
You were just hungry...we’re all hungry.... (then) I’m sorry I yelled at you.

text: Joe, referring to an open book, rhythmically moves the fl downward against the dry wood until he gets a spark. He stares at it, shocked...then remembers to BLOW. FIRE. On Joe: amazed at the fire, and at himself.

location: HOUSE IN THE WOODS, FIRE PIT

Goddam it... He drops the bird in, averting his eyes. The water bubble sizzles, hisses.

text: Joe yanks feathers from the bird. Wings, then neck. We ca tell he’s not happy about it, but it has to be done.
The carcass is laid out on a rock, next to a reference bo Joe holds a machete.
(reading) “Gut bird, slicing vertically from rectum to collar. Save the heart, liver and gizzard if you wish.” (MORE)
(to book) Go fuck yourself. He scrunches up his face and makes an incision.

Joe wipes his hands with a rag looking down at something: A nicely cooked STARLING, still whole, on a platter. Soot marks and stab wounds aside, it’s an appetizing sight. Joe scatters some berries into the plate beside the bird, the sake of aesthetics... Then places a single green HERB on top. He sits down, stares at his preparation. He does not smil instead, he looks at the empty chairs around the table. He sighs... Then looks past the chairs, squinting. Joe's POV: Patrick’s BUSHMAN MASK hangs by the door. Star at him. Off Joe's face...

Joe pulls his chair up again, nodding across the table. Reverse to: The MASK, a lousy rendition of Patrick, hangs from the to the chair. It stares back at Joe. Joe starts eating. He opens his mouth to speak...then clo it...then opens it.

Wha...I...Um... (comes to his senses) Yeah. Joe stares at the mask for a sad beat, then returns to hi meal. Suddenly - oddly - the mask chair SHIFTS. Joe stops chewi and smiles. A fleeting moment of delusion.  100.

..-Hello? The chair shifts again. Not much, an inch or two. But the movement is obvious. Joe’s smile disappears -- something isn’t right. He pushes his chair back, slowly ducking under the table. and finds

Moving quickly toward his legs. Joe collapses out of his chair, terrified. The snake BITE but is still too far away to connect with Joe. Joe regains his footing and runs to the center of the roo It moves toward him, sizing him up, HISSING... Joe takes two steps back, and the snake quickly covers th ground. A beat on Joe, looking around, gaging his distance to the door, versus where the snake is. He will lose that race. The snake is only a few feet away, approaching tentativel Joe is cornered. Last option: Joe takes a deep breath, and STANDS HIS GROUND. The snake pauses. Joe closes his eyes, and puts his hand on his chest. He exhales slowly. Tries to relax. When he opens his eyes... The snake has re-coiled. It, too, is relaxed. Its tongue flicks out every two seconds. Rhythmic. In sync with Joe' breathing. Totally calm, Joe sits Indian-style across from the snake His eyes never leave it. EXT. BIAGGIO’S STREET - DAY To establish. INT. BIAGGIO’S ROOM - DAY Biaggio kneels by his bed, head bowed. He holds ROSARY BE  101. INT. BIAGGIO’S KITCHEN - DAY Biaggio enters. His FATHER sits at the table, shucking clams. The following dialogue is in Italian, subtitled.
Dad?
Sit. He pushes a bowl of closed clams toward Biaggio, and hand him a shucking knife. Biaggio goes to work.
Have you ever quit at anything?
Of course.
+.-and did it hurt?
Well, there’s good quitting and bad quitting. I quit drinking soda: good quitting. I quit law school: bad quitting. Do you see?
Yes. (then) Did you ever quit on a friend?
You should never quit on a friend, Biaggio.
But say you did. Say you abandoned him, left him alone even after you swore your allegiance...would you go to hell for that?

Of course. Biaggio nods. He already knew this.  102. EXT. BIAGGIO’S HOUSE - DAY Long lens. Biaggio walks outside, and into his yard. Pull back to reveal a REARVIEW MIRROR in the foreground... We’re watching from Frank’s car. Biaggio blasts out of hi backyard on a bicycle. Frank shifts into gear.
Biaggio parks dismounts, and walks it into the woods. Onc Biaggio has wiped frame, reveal Frank’s car PULLING UP in background...

Biaggio emerges from the path, sighs with relief at the s of the house. Biaggio’s POV: The house looks better than ever. Refinished. Fire burning. The colors seem more vibrant, the angles of incident more square.
Kid, what the fuck is this. Biaggio turns around; his eyes could not be wider.
On Joe’s face: Asleep, slumped against the wall. In the s clothes as the last time we saw him.
How long? The whole time?? Joe startles AWAKE. BIAGGIO’S VOICE Omerta. The Sicilian code of silence.
No! No Omerta! Widen out: He’s sitting on the floor, as he was when the snake was there...but there’s no snake.
Dad! Don’t come in! Seriously!
It's over Joe! It’s the end of the world! Frank barges through the door, holding Biaggio.
Dad, I mean it! There’s a Bullshit, Joe! Start snake in here-- explaining. From the beginning. Then:
Infamata. The serpent is COILED AT BIAGGIO’S FEET. Staring at him.
Whoa...
(hushed) Biaggio. Be still. Be calm.
I’m going to run. I feel that I have to.
Biaggio, do not run. A beat of tension. WE hear hissing. Then...Biaggio runs.

shit-- The snake is upon him instantly. Biaggio trips over himse and falls into the corner. Biaggio’s POV: the copperhead, coming straight for him. He SCREAMS. It bites him in the CHEEK. On Joe: horror.
(nauseous ) Oh. Oh my fucking Christ. Biaggio faints.  104. The snake turns toward Frank, and Frank immediately break into a run.
Dad! No-- Frank throws furniture and debris, trying to deter it.

The fuck is wrong with this thing?! The snake is upon him. Frank braces himself... Suddenly, JOE’S SHOE pins the snake to the floor, landing just beneath its head. It can’t move, can’t bite. A mache enters frame, decapitating it. Snake blood everywhere. Joe drops the machete, panting. A shaken hero.
Joe... They stare at each other, overwhelmed. Then: BIAGGIO’S VOICE Hello. Of course, Biaggio. They rush to him; he’s flush, breathi heavy. Bleeding from the puncture wounds in his cheek.
Did it get me?
A little bit. (to Frank) Dad, bury the head and body outside in two separate holes. The loose venom can attract other ones. But Frank doesn’t move. He still has so many questions.
Now, Dad. Joe moves to the cooler.
How do you feel?
Very different.  105. Joe hands him a plastic bag holding a bloody cut of raw m
Here. You need protein.
Frank scoops dirt over the snake’s body. He emits various sounds of disgust. Joe and Biaggio appear in the doorway.
(to Frank) We've got fifteen minutes. Did you drive here?
Yeah..(seeing something) Whoa...hey hey hey-- He points to a dark stain growing on Biaggio’s pants.
Biaggio!
Hm?
You’re pissing yourself, kid! Biaggio looks down - it’s true.
I can’t feel it. I can’t feel anything down there... Biaggio’s knees buckle. He VOMITS.
Shit. Systems are failing. Biaggio’s nose begin to run.
(out of it) I’m open. I’m open now, Joe. The snake opened me... Sweat, pooling at Biaggio’s collar bone. His eyes tear up Everything’s leaving him.  106.
Biaggio crawls to the sofa. Joe helps him over, rubs his back.
Okay, okay. Let it all out. (to Frank) Can you pull the car up to here??
Impossible...
(to Biaggio) Hey -- do you feel up to a little walk, buddy? Biaggio closes his eyes and pisses himself again.
He’s really...he can’t hold it, huh.
You’ve gotta carry him, Dad. Frank grimaces at Biaggio, who is soaked in himself.
Dad, he will die.
Joe, come over here. Come here. Joe walks over.
Yes, we could carry him. We could drive him to the hospital and hope for the best. We could put him through all that. Or we could just choose to remember him as he was.
Dad!
Frank lifts Biaggio off the sofa, across his shoulders. H flares his nostrils, nauseated.  107.
Ah fuck. He smells like vinegar.
Frank carries Biaggio through the woods. Joe runs just ah of them. Biaggio bumps around, moaning. It’s not a happy time in his life.
Joe and Biaggio in the backseat. Frank speeds, slaloming through traffic. The windows are open.
Keep him awake, Joe! Keep him talking!
(weak) Wash me...
He keeps asking me to wash him!
Godammit Biaggio! We can’t wash you! We don’t have the tools!
Clean my skin. Make my skin clean. Frank's POV - he blows through a yellow that just turned The camera flashes. He will get a ticket.
Fuck. In the backseat:
I’m open, Joe.
I know buddy. I know you’re open.
Joe...what if I start to do other things, Joe?  Joe looks 108.

Other things. Ass things.
Ass things...
What’s he saying? He gonna shit the car??
I don’t want to shit the car.
None of us want that. We’re all on the same team here.
You_gotta fight this thing, buddy.
Just don’t think about it. Keep talking to me. Just talk. We’re almost there and then you'll get medicine and the pain will stop.
(at death’s door) Joe...I’m sorry...I’m sorry I led him here...
It's okay man. You didn’t know.
I didn’t know...I’m not...I would never betray you...I’m not like Patrick...
Yeah... out the window. A beat of sadness.
Biaggio, do you-- But something’s wrong. Biaggio’s eyes are CLOSED, his mou foaming.  109.
Oh God. Oh Jesus. His mouth, Dad! He’s foaming at the mouth!
Uh...That’s good! That means his body's fighting it.
Biaggio! Fuck! Dad, he’s dead!

Frank rushes Biaggio in. Joe waves at a nurse for attenti She takes Biaggio. Doctors arrive. A stretcher. Medical chaos ensues. Joe and Frank watch, concerned, helpless. We FADE TO WHITE.
Joe washes his face. A knock on the door. Joe opens it; Frank in the hallway.

Try these. Frank hands him a bag from the hospital gift shop. Quick cuts: Joe brushes his teeth He puts on deodorant. He looks at himself in the mirror, shirtless, slaps his exposed rib cage once. Joe puts on a fresh $4 T-shirt. It says “NYC.”  110. Joe regards a razor...looks at his moustache...puts the r back in the bag. He owns the moustache now. INT. HOSPITAL, BIAGGIO’S ROOM - NIGHT Biaggio sits up in bed. He eats from a small plastic container of apple sauce.
You honestly believe you saw heaven? Biaggio nods.
Yes. Joe...I saw your mother.
My mother’s still alive.
Oh. Then maybe it was my mother. Suddenly, VICKI enters.

Oh my God. Look at you! Then, right behind her...KELLY. And PATRICK. Joe tenses up. This is the first time we’ve seen Patrick ‘back.’ He looks good, put some weight back on. Haircut. Pressed shirt. Joe and Patrick see each other, then look away.
Are you okay, Biaggio?
I am. My body is healing. Some have suggested it wasn’t my time.
Yeah -- you’re fourteen man.
Joe, are you hurt? Joe shakes his head “no.” Awkwardness in the room.  111.
(at Biaggio’s bandage) Is that where it bit you?
It is.
My God...what did it feel like?
It felt like, when you’re expecting great pain, and then it happens. As the girls question Biaggio, Joe and Patrick make, then retract, eye contact. They have no idea how to be around each other.

Joe eats a slice of pizza. Two more pizza crusts litter h plate. There’s also an empty bowl of nachos. We see the cafeteria is virtually empty except for Joe an Frank watches his son eat. As Joe finishes, Frank pushes own plate of spaghetti toward Joe.
How long was Biaggio dead?
Six minutes.
(unimpressed) Six minutes? Oh.
That’s a long time to be dead, Dad.
Not in the scheme of things. (then) You...uh...you did a good job, Joe. You did a good job back there.
A good job?  112.
You saved my life. You saved Biaggio’s life. I dunno. A lesser man would have panicked.
Oh. Thanks. A beat between father and son.
Are you still hungry? What do you want. Anything.
Honestly? I would love seafood.
Hm. Frank looks around at the shitty hospital food court.
I don’t know if this is the best place for that. (then) They have churros.
Joe eats a churro.
Not bad, right? Joe shakes his head. Not bad.
(carefully) We can do seafood tomorrow. plan on being around. If you
Yeah. I should be. Frank nods. Relief.
So who's that girl Patrick was with? He’s got a girlfriend, huh?  113.
Looks that way.
Good for him. What are you guys, fourteen? (then) If you think parents and school and all this shit is stressful, wait until you start carving the Ham.
The Ham. Like, the Ham?
Yeah, like HAMphibian. HAMbush.
You know about the Ham?
Yeah, I mean...I thought it was common. Isn’t it?
No, I guess it must be. Huh. (then) I thought I was alone.

Joe and Frank wait by the elevator. The down arrow DINGS. The doors open. Patrick, his parents, and Kelly are inside. Joe and Frank enter. A nurse wheels an elderly patient in with them. Doors close on the packed elevator.

Everyone stands in silence. We hear only the wet, rattlin breath of the elderly patient. INT/EXT. FRANK’S CAR - NIGHT Frank and Joe drive. Joe looks out the window at his neighborhood. Then the McGuire family car pulls up alongside them, pass them. Patrick and Kelly in the backseat.  114. They stop at a red light. Joe glances over; he’s in line with Patrick, who isn’t looking. Then, Patrick looks. Joe immediately turns away. He turns back; now Patrick turns away. Joe leans back. Staring ahead. He glances over, subtly, trying not to move his head, and sees Patrick smiling and shaking his head. Joe looks over. Finally, he smiles too. Joe shoots Patrick the finger. Patrick nods and returns i Joe gestures behind Patrick toward Kelly. He inserts his pointer finger into the end of his fist, then raises his eyebrows inquisitively. Patrick laughs, shakes his head no. Joe then places his hands on his chest. A new question. Patrick shrugs and smiles coyly. Joe's eyes widen. Really? Patrick shrugs again, with a big shit-eating grin. Joe laughs. The light changes. Joe’s car starts to inch up. They’re losing sight of each other. Frank senses the activity.
What’s going on over there?
(facing forward again) Nothing. Patrick’s being an idiot.
Wide, looking down at the intersection. Patrick’s car tak a right, while Joe’s continues straight. As the cars disappear, we tilt up, over the rooftops, toward the sky.

END CREDITS ROLL over a wide shot of the house. The fores teems around it. Animals wander in and out, confused. Lig shifts as hours pass. In time, the sun sets on the empty house, though the fire still burns. THE END.
